intro: Canthium obscurum, commonly known as blackwood or nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream sides. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
